test_cases.test_name: Environmental Monitoring System Temperature Accuracy Verification
test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) accurately measures temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.
prerequisites: EMS system installed and powered on
Test environment prepared with controlled temperature settings

test_steps.action: Set the test environment to -80°C using the temperature reference device.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature within -80.5°C to -79.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the test environment to +50°C using the temperature reference device.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature within +49.5°C to +50.5°C.

acceptance_criteria: EMS temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of the reference device readings at both test points.
data_integrity_requirements: All temperature readings must be stored in the vendor's standard database format.
Audit trail must be maintained for all temperature readings.

test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.
prerequisites: EMS system installed and powered on
Test environment prepared with controlled temperature settings

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to +25°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature setpoint as +25°C.

test_steps.action: Increase the test environment temperature to +27°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert indicating temperature deviation.

test_steps.action: Decrease the test environment temperature to +23°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert indicating temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: EMS must generate alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.
data_integrity_requirements: All alerts must be stored in the vendor's standard database format.
Audit trail must be maintained for all alert events.

test_cases.test_name: Environmental Monitoring System - Temperature Data Recording Verification
test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS correctly records temperature data at specified intervals and maintains accuracy within ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set up test environment with known temperature values (-20°C, +5°C, +25°C).
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts test temperature values without errors.

test_steps.action: Monitor system for 30 minutes, recording temperature values every 5 minutes.
test_steps.expected_result: System records temperature at exact 5-minute intervals.

test_steps.action: Compare recorded values against reference thermometer readings.
test_steps.expected_result: All recorded values within ±0.5°C of reference values.

acceptance_criteria: 100% of temperature readings recorded at correct intervals
No missing data points during test period
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be complete and accurate
Timestamps must be correct and immutable

test_cases.test_name: Chromatography Data System - Custom Calculation Verification
test_cases.objective: Verify that custom calculations implemented in the CDS produce accurate results for non-standard impurity calculations.

test_steps.action: Load test chromatogram with known impurity profile into CDS.
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly identifies all peaks in chromatogram.

test_steps.action: Apply custom impurity calculation formula to test data.
test_steps.expected_result: System executes formula without errors.

test_steps.action: Compare CDS results with manually calculated values.
test_steps.expected_result: Results match within acceptable tolerance (±0.1%).

acceptance_criteria: All custom calculations execute without errors
System maintains data integrity throughout process
data_integrity_requirements: Calculation formulas must be locked after validation
Raw data must remain unchanged during processing

test_cases.test_name: Environmental Monitoring System Temperature Accuracy Verification
test_cases.objective: Verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) accurately measures temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the EMS to monitor temperature in a controlled environment.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature readings.

test_steps.action: Compare EMS temperature readings with the calibrated reference device at various temperature points.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS readings are within ±0.5°C of the reference device readings.

acceptance_criteria: EMS temperature readings are within ±0.5°C of the reference device readings at all tested points
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature readings are recorded and stored accurately

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.

test_steps.action: Set the EMS temperature setpoint to a specific value.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays the configured setpoint.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert for the temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: EMS generates alerts for temperature deviations of ±2°C from the setpoint
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alerts are recorded and stored accurately

test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) continuously monitors temperature in all GMP storage areas as specified in URS-EMS-001.

test_steps.action: Set temperature setpoint to 25°C in the EMS configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts the setpoint and displays it correctly.

test_steps.action: Monitor temperature readings for 30 minutes.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature readings are recorded at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes as per URS-EMS-002.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of +3°C.
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert as specified in URS-EMS-005.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature readings are continuous and within specified intervals.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature data is stored securely and cannot be altered.

test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS uses vendor-supplied software without modification as specified in URS-EMS-003.

test_steps.action: Launch the EMS software.
test_steps.expected_result: Software launches successfully without errors.

test_steps.action: Navigate through the software menus.
test_steps.expected_result: All menus and functions are accessible and function as expected.

test_steps.action: Generate a standard report using vendor's reporting engine.
test_steps.expected_result: Report is generated successfully and matches the vendor's standard format.

data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all software functions are unaltered from vendor's standard.

test_cases.test_name: Verify Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) Temperature Accuracy
test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS accurately measures and records temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.
prerequisites: Test environment set to specific temperature points

test_steps.action: Set the test environment to -80°C using the reference device.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature within -80.5°C to -79.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the test environment to +50°C using the reference device.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature within +49.5°C to +50.5°C.

acceptance_criteria: EMS temperature readings are within ±0.5°C of the reference device at all test points.
regulatory_basis: 21 CFR Part 11 compliance for electronic records
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature readings are recorded and stored without modification.
Verify audit trail captures all temperature data entries.
urs_requirements: URS-EMS-004: Temperature range: -80°C to +50°C with accuracy of ±0.5°C.

test_cases.test_name: Validate Chromatography Data System (CDS) Custom Calculations
test_cases.objective: To validate that the CDS correctly performs custom calculations for non-standard impurity calculations and proprietary relative response factor adjustments.

test_steps.action: Load test chromatographic data into the CDS.
test_steps.expected_result: Data is successfully loaded and displayed in the CDS interface.

test_steps.action: Apply custom impurity calculation formula to the data.
test_steps.expected_result: CDS calculates impurity values according to the custom formula.

test_steps.action: Apply proprietary relative response factor adjustments.
test_steps.expected_result: CDS adjusts response factors as per the proprietary algorithm.

acceptance_criteria: Custom calculations match expected results based on predefined test data.
Proprietary adjustments are correctly applied and reflected in the final results.
regulatory_basis: 21 CFR Part 11 compliance for electronic records
GMP requirements for analytical data integrity
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all calculations are performed without data loss or corruption.
Verify audit trail captures all calculation steps and adjustments.
urs_requirements: URS-CDS-004: Implement custom calculations using vendor's formula editor.
